main event: A USMC pilot reported sighting a whitish object which he described as approximately 25 feet in diameter. The object was observed to make an abrupt change in course and to accelerate rapidly.
interesting points: The object was circular in shape and appeared to be metallic in nature. It was very bright and reflected the sun's rays.
The object was estimated to be about 40 to 50 feet in diameter and was observed for approximately 2 minutes.
The object appeared to be traversing a straight course and was under intelligent control.
The observer was an experienced pilot flying an F-86 aircraft. The sighting occurred during daylight hours.

Three pilots in the air observed an unidentified object for a period of 6 minutes. The object was silver in color, round in shape, and approximately 30 feet in diameter. It was observed to make a sudden 90 degree turn and accelerate at a high rate of speed before disappearing.
sighted object: a whitish object, circular in shape, metallic in nature, and approximately 25-50 feet in diameter
witnesses: USMC pilot, three Air Force pilots
